meanings.definition: The act of removing someone from a position of power or authority, especially a monarch.
meanings.sent1: The dethronement of the king was swift and unexpected.
meanings.sent2: After the dethronement, the queen had to adjust to a new way of life.
meanings.sent3: The dethronement of the principal in the school play led to chaos backstage.
meanings.sent4: The dethronement of the CEO shook the entire company.
meanings.sent5: The dethronement of the dictator was celebrated by the people.

meanings.definition: The state of being removed from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: His dethronement left him feeling lost and powerless.
meanings.sent2: The dethronement of the mayor was met with mixed reactions from the public.
meanings.sent3: The dethronement of the top student in the class rankings was a shock to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The dethronement of the champion marked the beginning of a new era.
meanings.sent5: The dethronement of the queen bee caused a shift in the hive's dynamics.
